sentence.Network_en: Poor eyesight will incapacitate you for a job in the library.
sentence.Network_cn: 视力差将使你不适合于在图书馆工作.

sentence.Network_en: A device or substance gas, used to incapacitate riot control.
sentence.Network_cn: 用化学物质杀死 、 伤害或使敌人无力的战争.

sentence.Network_en: His poor health incapacitate him for work.
sentence.Network_cn: 他健康不佳使他不能工作.

entry.def: If something incapacitates you, it weakens you in some way, so that you cannot do certain things.

example.ex: A serious fall incapacitated the 68-year-old congressman.
example.tran: 一次严重跌伤使这位 68 岁的国会议员丧失了行动能力。

means.word_mean: 1. make unable to perform a certain action;

sentences.sentence: "He was disabled in a car accident"

auth_sentence.content: Unfortunately, the concentrations of war gasses needed to incapacitate someone are tiny.
auth_sentence.res_content: Unfortunately, the concentrations of war gasses needed to incapacitate someone are tiny.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Unfortunately, the concentrations of war gasses needed to incapacitate someone are tiny.

auth_sentence.content: Severe injuries -- deep gashes, broken bones -- and chronic pains isolate and incapacitate the sufferer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Severe injuries -- deep gashes, broken bones -- and chronic pains isolate and incapacitate the sufferer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Severe injuries -- deep gashes, broken bones -- and chronic pains isolate and incapacitate the sufferer.

auth_sentence.content: It is not only a headache but has many other symptoms that may incapacitate a patient.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is not only a headache but has many other symptoms that may incapacitate a patient.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is not only a headache but has many other symptoms that may incapacitate a patient.

stems_affixes.word_buile: cap可取之处+able能……的→adj.有能力的, 能干的
capacity[[n.容量,才能]]→adj.宽阔的;容积大的
cap拿,抓,握住+acity表名词→拿住的能力→容量;才能
cap抓+ion表名词→抓住主要内容→标题

sentences.en: By this time my father was totally incapacitated by his illness.
sentences.cn: 那时候我父亲已经病得完全不能自理了。
